greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest sequence such that for all i, j, a(i) = a(j) => A009195(i) = A009195(j) and f(i) = f(j), where f(n) = gcd(n,sigma(n)) * (-1)^[gcd(n,sigma(n))==n] and A009195(n) = gcd(n, phi(n)).
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of the ordered pair [A009195(n), A326193(n)].
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 24 2019
